question: 補助動詞
userExplanation:
#below means "used by"
~ている to be (doing) ~
~てある to have been done ~
~ておく To do ~ for later
～てみる to try to do ~ and see the outcome
～てあげる to do ~ as a favor for someone #giver
～て差し上げる  as above but humble #giver
～てくれる to do ~ as a favor for inferior #receiver
～てやる ~ as a favor for inferior rude #giver
～てもらう to have [someone] do ~ for you #receiver
～ていただく as above but polite #receiver
～ていく to do ~ away from you
~てくる to do ~ coming toward you
~てしまう to end up doing ~ regrettable, by accident
userExplanationLong:
In Japanese, hojo-doushi 補助動詞, literally "support verb," is a type of auxiliary verb that attaches to the te-form of verbs or the adverbial form of i-adjectives.

For example: tabete-iru 食べている, "to be eating," has the verb iru いる, "to exist," as a support verb for taberu 食べる, "to eat."
